Vadym Yudenko is a Researcher at the Institute for Behavioral Studies at American University Kyiv. His research focuses on how war experiences impact decision-making, particularly regarding forced relocation, financial wellbeing, and perception of safety. He holds a BA in Management and Administration from KNEU and is completing an MSc in Business and Financial Economics from Kyiv School of Economics. Vadym is also studying Statistics and Data Science from MIT.

:::{.column-body-outset}
